result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas L Rentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
State states joint recommendations.  Atty Dolch agrees and enters NC plea.  DE also pleads NC.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court advises DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State notes they are in compliance w/victim rights and makes statement re: the joint recommendation.  Atty Dolch makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 2:  NC
8 days jail w/work release - 6 days credit for time served
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Atty Dolch acknowledges rec. information.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Dolch stands mute.  Court enters NG pleas to all counts.

1:11 PM Defendant Nicholas L Rentz in court.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Nicholas L Rentz.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court quashes warrant previously stayed to today's date.  Atty Dolch files written waiver of prelim.  DE agrees to waive prelim.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.

9:41 AM Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Nicholas L Rentz.  Attorney Natalia J Gess in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances and Court notes DE got notice in hand.  Atty Dolch states she talked to DE this morning and he thought he would be able to appear by phone or video - he lives in Rock Co and transportation is an issue.  State requests warrant.  Atty Dolch states they are resolved once the DE appears.  Requests a reset.  Court authorizes warrant but stays it to 10/7/22 at 2pm.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas L Rentz in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Nicholas L Rentz. Atty Hayes advises DE was unaware of the notice of hearing.  Atty Hayes advises the address is correct and is unsure why the mail was returned.  State does not object to reinstatement of previous bond.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates previous bond.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return on warrant on August 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
